title: Union Budget 2025: Govt may introduce personal income tax breaks, says report - Moneycontrol
summary:
Union Budget 2025: Govt may introduce personal income tax breaks, says report

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: CNBC-TV18

The Centre is considering introducing personal income-tax breaks to boost consumption.

  • The standard deduction limit may be increased from Rs 75,000 a year.
  • Expansion of the income range for the 20% tax rate from Rs 12–15 lakh to Rs 12–20 lakh is being considered.
  • This move could provide relief to taxpayers in the Rs 15–20 lakh bracket.
Moneycontrol couldn't verify the report independently.

This potential tax reform is aimed at making the new tax regime more attractive to taxpayers.
newTitle: Union Budget 2025: Govt may introduce personal income tax breaks, says report

title: Supreme Court Stays HC Order Requiring Delhi Govt To Sign MoU With Centre On Implementation Of PM-ABHIM... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Halts Delhi HC Order on PM-ABHIM MoU

Publication Date: Today

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court today stayed the Delhi High Court order requiring the Delhi government to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Centre for the implementation of the PM-Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) in Delhi.

  • The Supreme Court's bench comprised Justices BR Gavai and AG Masih.
  • The Delhi government challenged the High Court's order, citing concerns over the scope of the Centre's powers in health matters.
  • Delhi government's counsel argued that while the Centre could cover 60% of capital expenditure, it would not fund running costs.
  • The High Court's order arose from a public interest litigation (PIL) about ICU beds and ventilator availability.
  • Previously, the High Court expressed concerns about insufficient medical infrastructure in Delhi.
“Non-implementation of the PM-ABHIM Scheme in Delhi, when 33 States/UTs have already implemented the same, would not be justified.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's stay on the High Court's directive highlights ongoing tensions between local and federal health authorities regarding the implementation of critical health infrastructure projects.
newTitle: Supreme Court Halts Delhi HC Order on PM-ABHIM MoU

title: Supreme Court Pauses High Court Order Over Ayushman Bharat Scheme In Delhi - NDTV
summary:
Supreme Court Pauses High Court Order Over Ayushman Bharat Scheme In Delhi

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court has temporarily halted a Delhi High Court ruling that mandated the Delhi government to execute a Memorandum of Understanding to facilitate the implementation of the Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) scheme.

  • The Supreme Court issued notices to the central government, AIIMS, and the Municipal Corporation of Delhi in response to a petition from the Delhi government against the High Court ruling.
  • Last month, the Delhi High Court ordered the MoU to be signed by January 5.
  • The AAP government argues against the scheme, claiming that Delhi has better benefits under its own health schemes.
  • This issue could escalate political tensions between the BJP and AAP ahead of crucial government elections in the city.
  • The Delhi government's counsel contends that signing the MoU would overstep the central government’s authority regarding health policy.
The High Court stated, “Not implementing the ABHIM Scheme in Delhi would not be justified since 33 States and UTs have already implemented it.”

This development highlights ongoing political friction regarding health policy and governance between the central and Delhi state authorities.
newTitle: Supreme Court Pauses Implementation of Ayushman Bharat Scheme in Delhi

title: 'We'll Resolve If Not Resolved By Next Week' : Supreme Court On Deadlock Over Tamil Nadu University VC... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
US Consulate inaugurated in Bengaluru, visa services to start soon, says Eric Garcetti - Hindustan Times
summary:
US Consulate inaugurated in Bengaluru, visa services to start soon, says Eric Garcetti

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The United States has officially inaugurated its consulate in Bengaluru with plans to start visa services soon. This was marked by a ceremony led by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and US Ambassador Eric Garcetti.

  • The consulate will initially operate from a temporary location at the JW Marriott Hotel.
  • Jaishankar emphasized the importance of having a permanent US diplomatic presence in Bengaluru.
  • Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar called the opening a significant event.
  • BJP MP Tejasvi Surya noted the consulate's importance for local residents.
  • Garcetti confirmed that visa services will commence in the future.
“It has been something long in waiting...” - S Jaishankar

The establishment of the consulate underscores Bengaluru's global importance, with a commitment from the US to enhance its diplomatic presence in India.
newTitle: US Consulate Inaugurated in Bengaluru, Visa Services Coming Soon

title: RG Kar rape-murder: Verdict on Saturday. CBI seeks Sanjay Roy's death sentence: The case so far| Top points - Hindustan Times
Medics start 'cease work' protest at Bengal's medical college against suspension of six colleagues - The Hindu
summary:
Medics start 'cease work' protest at Bengal's medical college against suspension of six colleagues

Published: January 17, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Junior medics at the Midnapore Medical College and Hospital began an indefinite complete cease work following the suspension of six colleagues by the West Bengal government, allegedly for their role in a tragic incident involving a woman’s death after childbirth.

  • Doctors argue that the suspension aims to distract from ongoing corruption in the health department.
  • The junior medics stated their protest began in solidarity with suspended colleagues.
  • The government has suspended 12 doctors overall due to negligence related to administering 'expired' intravenous fluids.
  • Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced actions to prevent further use of the disputed intravenous fluid in state-run hospitals.
"All junior doctors of the MMCH stand in solidarity with our fellow colleagues in this state of moral crisis, and announce complete cease work from today morning (8 AM)." - Junior medic

This protest underlines the ongoing tensions within the healthcare system in West Bengal and raises questions about accountability and systemic issues.
newTitle: Medics protest in Bengal over suspension of colleagues

title: Bengaluru: 7-year-old special child goes missing in Sarjapur, police launch investigation - Hindustan Times
summary:
Investigation Underway as 7-Year-Old Special Child Goes Missing in Sarjapur, Bengaluru

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A 7-year-old boy named Elvin Dsouza has been reported missing from Sarjapur, Bengaluru, prompting an urgent investigation by local authorities.

  • Elvin was last seen on January 16 at 2:30 PM playing with his cycle.
  • His mother left him briefly to attend to a washing machine technician and found him missing upon return.
  • CCTV footage shows Elvin near a water tank until 2:44 PM, after which he was not seen.
  • Elvin is autistic and non-verbal, last seen wearing a light blue shirt and black shorts.
  • Reports on social media suggested he had been found, but this was confirmed false by his parents.
  • The parents have filed a missing person report, and police are reviewing footage and conducting searches.
“When I returned around 3 pm, both Elvin and his cycle were gone,” - Elvin's mother

Authorities continue to search for Elvin, with the hopes of reuniting him with his family soon.
newTitle: Investigation Underway as 7-Year-Old Special Child Goes Missing in Sarjapur, Bengaluru

Delhi NCR Schools Closed: Which classes are suspended in these areas? - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi NCR Schools Closed: Classes Suspended Due to Cold Wave

Date & Source: January 16, 2025 - Indian Express

North India is experiencing a cold wave, prompting the closure of schools in the Delhi NCR region. The schools are implementing changes to class formats due to poor air quality.

  • All private and governmental schools in Delhi NCR are ordered to close physical classes.
  • In Noida, classes from nursery to Class 8 are suspended until January 17.
  • Classes 9 and 11 will shift to hybrid mode, using online learning where feasible.
  • The air quality index in the region has worsened, prompting a response under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP).
“All heads of government, government-aided, unaided private schools under DoE, NDMC, MCD, and the Delhi Cantonment Board are directed to conduct hybrid classes for students up to Class 9 and 11, wherever online learning is feasible.”

The decision reflects the harsh winter conditions affecting education delivery in the region and focuses on student safety amidst environmental concerns.
newTitle: Delhi NCR Schools Closed: Classes Suspended Due to Cold Wave

title: Delhi fog today: Several flights delayed at IGI airport; AQI improves after rain - Hindustan Times
Kerala samadhi case: Self-styled guru’s body found in sitting position and covered in ash, police say - The Indian Express
summary:
Kerala Samadhi Case: Body of Self-Styled Guru Found in Sitting Position

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The investigation into the death of self-styled guru Gopan Swami has progressed following the exhumation of his body, which was found in a sitting position and covered with ash, from a concrete chamber at his residence in Thiruvananthapuram.

  • The body was exhumed for postmortem analysis to determine the cause of death.
  • Police reported no external injuries found on the body.
  • Gopan's family claimed he entered a state of samadhi before being placed in the chamber.
  • There had been public concerns about his mysterious disappearance, leading to a police investigation.
  • Kerala High Court dismissed the family's objection to the exhumation.
  • A maha samadhi ceremony is planned for Gopan, according to local community leaders.
“A spiritual guru was insulted, and he will be given a maha samadhi.” - Vishnupuram Chandrasekharan

The findings of the postmortem will ultimately confirm the family's assertions of a natural death amidst ongoing curiosity and controversy surrounding Gopan Swami's case.
newTitle: Kerala Samadhi Case: Body of Self-Styled Guru Found in Sitting Position

title: 'People forced to sleep on footpaths in freezing cold': Rahul Gandhi visits Delhi AIIMS; see video - The Times of India
summary:
People Forced to Sleep on Footpaths in Freezing Cold: Rahul Gandhi Visits Delhi AIIMS

Publication Date: [insert date here] | Source: [insert source here]

Rahul Gandhi visited the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi to highlight the plight of individuals forced to sleep on the streets due to the extreme cold.

  • Rahul Gandhi emphasizes the need for urgent assistance for vulnerable populations.
  • Local community leaders join the visit to raise awareness.
  • Calls for government action to address homelessness, especially during harsh weather.
“No one should have to suffer this way in our nation,” said Rahul Gandhi during his visit.

This visit sheds light on the ongoing issue of homelessness and the lack of adequate shelter during extreme weather conditions.
newTitle: People Forced to Sleep on Footpaths in Freezing Cold: Rahul Gandhi Visits Delhi AIIMS

title: Why is Modi pampering Chiranjeevi so much?.. - Greatandhra
summary:
Why is Modi pampering Chiranjeevi so much?

Publication Date: January 13, 2024 | Source: unknown

Megastar Chiranjeevi, despite having distanced himself from active politics, continues to be a focal point in Andhra Pradesh's political landscape, especially following his appearance alongside Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the Sankranti celebrations in Delhi.

  • Chiranjeevi’s presence at political events is raising questions about the BJP's strategies in Andhra Pradesh.
  • During the event, he received special attention from Modi, which is unusual for non-political figures.
  • Chiranjeevi's previous appearances with Modi suggest ongoing political ties.
  • Speculation arises regarding whether Modi is preparing to bring Chiranjeevi into the BJP fold.
  • Chiranjeevi’s Kapu identity may be significant for the BJP's political ambitions, given the party's struggles in the region.
“A potential ‘double-engine’ political arrangement, with Pawan Kalyan and Chiranjeevi as key faces, could bolster the BJP’s ambitions in Andhra Pradesh.”

The growing speculation around Modi’s fondness for Chiranjeevi potentially hints at larger electoral strategies within Andhra Pradesh.
newTitle: Why is Modi pampering Chiranjeevi so much?

title: 8th Pay Commission approved: What does it mean? Who will benefit after Cabinet nod? Key facts - Hindustan Times
summary:
8th Pay Commission approved: What does it mean? Who will benefit after Cabinet nod? Key facts

Date: Jan 17, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Union Cabinet, led by PM Narendra Modi, has approved the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission to revise salaries of central government employees and pensioners, ahead of the 2025 Union Budget and Delhi assembly elections.

  • Approximately 49 lakh central government employees and 65 lakh pensioners will benefit from the new commission.
  • The 7th Pay Commission was established in 2016, with a term ending in 2026.
  • The decision is expected to improve the quality of life and boost consumption, according to PM Modi.
  • Consultations with stakeholders will be held for appointing the commission members.
“Setting up the 8th Pay Commission well before the term of the 7th Pay Commission ends in 2026 will give us sufficient time to receive recommendations,” - Ashwini Vaishnaw.

This timely decision aims to ensure timely salary revisions and enhance overall economic conditions for millions.
newTitle: 8th Pay Commission approved: Benefits and Key Facts

title: Delhi: Rahul Gandhi meets patients in AIIMS, listens to their problems - Newsroompost
summary:
Rahul Gandhi Visits AIIMS to Address Patient Concerns

Published:   January 17, 2025

Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi to meet and listen to patients' concerns regarding their treatment.

  • He met with several patients and their families, addressing their frustrations about treatment delays.
  • Patients expressed gratitude for his attention and support, particularly highlighting issues faced due to insufficient treatment.
  • Gandhi's visit emphasized the challenges of accessing healthcare in Delhi, reflecting on patients who must wait indefinitely for care.
  • The Congress party criticized the government's handling of health services in a post on social media.
“Waiting for months for treatment, inconvenience and insensitivity of the government – this is the reality of Delhi AIIMS today.”

Gandhi's visit underlined the urgent need for reforms in the healthcare system as families wait desperately for treatment, especially those with children suffering from severe illnesses.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Visits AIIMS to Address Patient Concerns

title: Saif Ali Khan stabbing: Sharmila Tagore, Soha Ali Khan arrive at Lilavati Hospital - Hindustan Times
summary:
Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Family Visits Hospital Following Attack

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Saif Ali Khan's family is deeply concerned following a stabbing incident that occurred at his residence. His mother, Sharmila Tagore, and sister, Soha Ali Khan, visited him at Lilavati Hospital.

  • Saif was attacked at his Bandra residence when attempting to intervene during an altercation involving an intruder.
  • He sustained multiple stab wounds, leading to a serious injury to his thoracic spinal cord.
  • Saif underwent surgery and is reported to be stable and recovering well.
  • Kareena Kapoor Khan shared a public statement highlighting the family's challenging day and requesting privacy.
  • The incident has raised safety concerns in Mumbai and sparked worry among fans and colleagues.
“It has been an incredibly challenging day for our family... I kindly request that you respect our boundaries and give us the space we need to heal...”

This alarming event underscores ongoing discussions about safety and security within urban environments.
newTitle: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing: Family Visits Hospital Following Attack

Why weren't banned IV fluid stocks withdrawn, Calcutta HC asks Bengal government - The Times of India
summary:
Calcutta HC Questions Bengal Government on Withdrawal of Banned IV Fluids

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

The Calcutta High Court has raised questions regarding why the West Bengal government has not withdrawn stocks of banned intravenous fluids, highlighting concerns over public health and safety.

  • The court is scrutinizing the state’s handling of prohibited medical supplies.
  • It emphasizes the potential health risks associated with these fluids.
  • The government has been asked to provide a detailed explanation for the oversight.
“The safety of patients is paramount, and the state must act decisively.”

This inquiry underscores the judiciary's role in ensuring health regulations are enforced effectively.
newTitle: Calcutta HC Questions Bengal Government on Withdrawal of Banned IV Fluids

title: BJP puts out fourth list of nine names, makes room for allies - The Hindu
summary:
BJP Announces Fourth List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: The Hindu

With just one day left for the filing of nomination papers for the February 5 Delhi Assembly poll, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) announced its fourth list of nine candidates on Thursday, naming the party’s choices for the Greater Kailash and Babarpur Assembly constituencies from where Delhi Cabinet Ministers are contesting.

  • The BJP has announced 68 candidates for the 70-member House so far.
  • Shikha Rai will contest from Greater Kailash against AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj.
  • Anil Vashishth has been fielded from Badarpur against AAP’s Gopal Rai.
  • Allies Janata Dal (United) and Lok Janshakti Party are also naming their candidates.
  • Key candidates include Harish Khurana, Manjinder Singh Sirsa, and AAP’s Manish Sisodia.
“The last day for nominations is January 17; for withdrawal, it is January 20.”

This latest round of candidate announcements underscores the BJP's preparations for the upcoming assembly elections, highlighting key strategies and alliances.
newTitle: BJP Announces Fourth List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

UGC bars 3 private universities from PhD admissions for 5 years; 30 others are under scrutiny - The Times of India
summary:
UGC Bars 3 Private Universities from PhD Admissions for 5 Years

Date: [Insert Date Here]

Source: [Insert Source Here]

In a significant move, the University Grants Commission (UGC) has imposed a five-year ban on three private universities from admitting PhD students, while 30 other institutions are currently under scrutiny.

  • UGC found discrepancies in the academic practices of the three banned universities.
  • Over 30 other institutions are now being evaluated for compliance with UGC regulations.
  • This decision is part of a broader effort to maintain academic standards in higher education.
“We are committed to upholding the quality of higher education in the country.” - UGC Official

This decision highlights the ongoing challenges faced by private universities in meeting regulatory standards and the UGC’s commitment to ensuring educational integrity.
newTitle: UGC Bars 3 Private Universities from PhD Admissions for 5 Years
